result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Angel Miramontes III

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Angel Miramontes III in court.  Attorney Connor Romenesko in court for Angel Miramontes III.  Attorney Patrick T. Franken in court for State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm 
Case calendared for Plea and Sentencing this date.  Defense requests adjournment.  No objection by the State.  Court grants request.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 30, 2023 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Angel Miramontes in court with attorney Connor Romenesko.  Patrick T. Franken appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Calendar Call. Discussions placed on the record. Court cancels the previous imposed and stayed bench warrant. Defense counsel further advises that parties are now in a resolution posture. Case adjourned for a Plea/Sentencing hearing to Br 16.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Attorney Connor Romenesko in court.  Patrick T. Franken appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Status Conference. Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until the next court date. Case adjourned for a Calendar Call to Br 16.  Calendar call scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Angel Miramontes in court with attorney Connor Romenesko, via zoom.  Amy E Spanczak appeared on behalf of Patrick Franken for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Scheduling Conference. Discussion with parties regarding discovery issues. Defense counsel informs court that they received an offer from the State. Court adjourns matter for a Status Conference to Br 16.  Status conference scheduled for August 3, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Actual Date Bond Posted with the Sheriff's Department 07/08/2021
Actual Date Bond Posted with the Sheriff's Department 07/08/2021
Actual Date Bond Posted with the Sheriff's Department 07/08/2021

Defendant Angel Miramontes in court with Attorney Connor Romenesko; both appear by video.  Erika Strebel appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Deputy G. Cox.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 16.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed. Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel

Court ordered the cash bail to be returned to the remitter.
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription and no dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Angel Miramontes in court with attorney Travis Schwantes.  Emily S Zimmel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 04/28/2022@1:00
